item.title: Societe Generale Beats Views on Strong Bond Trading
item.description: Societe Generale reported a lower net profit in the first quarter, but ahead of consensus, as weaker French retail activity was counterbalanced by strong fixed income trading.

item.title: Long Bond Yields Seen Unlikely to Fall Soon Given Sticky Core Inflation
item.description: Given the slow pace of decline in core inflation in the eurozone, it is premature to position for lower long rates, SEB said, which expects the German 10-year Bund yield to trade in a broad range around 2.40% in the coming months.

item.title: Fed Official Signals Support for Further Rate Increases
item.description: Federal Reserve governor Michelle Bowman says there hasn’t been sufficient evidence of a labor market or inflation slowdown.

item.title: UK Economy Ekes Out Growth
item.description: U.K. GDP grew 0.1% in the first quarter, in line with forecasts, though high inflation and further interest rate rises could put a lid on growth in the months to come.

item.title: GSK Trims Haleon Stake
item.description: GSK has cut its stake in Haleon to 10.3% by selling 240 million shares for 335 pence each and raising £804 million.

item.title: Nikkei Gains 0.9% Amid Rising Hopes for More Dovish Fed
item.description: Japan’s Nikkei Stock Average rose 0.9% to close at 29388.30 amid rising hopes for a more dovish Fed.

item.title: Sterling Could Fall if BOE Rates Already Peaked
item.description: Sterling looks vulnerable as the BOE’s 25bp interest-rate rise on Thursday was likely the last of the cycle, ING said.

item.title: Richemont Confident on Outlook as China Reopens
item.description: Richemont said it expected further strong demand ahead, particularly in China, after it booked an above-forecast operating profit for fiscal 2023 on a 14% rise in sales.

item.title: Allianz Profits Jump, Helped by U.S. Growth
item.description: Allianz posted a 24% rise in first-quarter operating profit, driven by growth in its U.S. life-health business and a stronger result in its property-casualty segment, but profits for the asset-management division–which houses Pimco–fell 13%.

item.title: Pandemic-Era Border Policy Expires Amid Migrant Surge
item.description: Thousands of migrants crossed into the U.S. before midnight in anticipation of harsher immigration rules with the expiration of Title 42.

item.title: AngloGold Ashanti Earnings Fall But Backs Outlook
item.description: AngloGold Ashanti reported lower adjusted earnings of $320 million in the first quarter as costs rose, confirmed its guidance for the year and said it intended to move its primary listing to New York.

item.title: Pandemic-Era Border Policy Expires Amid Migrant Surge
item.description: The pandemic-era border measure that for three years has served as a blunt border-enforcement tool for two successive administrations ended at midnight.

item.title: PacWest shares dropped 23%, dragging down other midsize banks, after the lender disclosed another round of deposit flight.
item.description: PacWest shares dropped 23%, dragging down other midsize banks, after the lender disclosed another round of deposit flight.

item.title: U.S. stock indexes ended mixed, with the S&P 500 and Dow losing 0.2% and 0.7%, respectively, while the Nasdaq rose 0.2%.
item.description: U.S. stock indexes ended mixed, with the S&P 500 and Dow losing 0.2% and 0.7%, respectively, while the Nasdaq rose 0.2%.

item.title: SoftBank said it was getting ready to go on the offensive again with an eye on investing in artificial-intelligence companies, as it reported a smaller net loss for the latest quarter.
item.description: SoftBank said it was getting ready to go on the offensive again with an eye on investing in artificial-intelligence companies, as it reported a smaller net loss for the latest quarter.

item.title: Pilots at Southwest Airlines voted to authorize a potential strike, seeking to increase pressure in yearslong contract negotiations with the company.
item.description: Pilots at Southwest Airlines voted to authorize a potential strike, seeking to increase pressure in yearslong contract negotiations with the company.

item.title: The Bank of England raised its key interest rate for the 12th consecutive time and signaled more increases are possible.
item.description: The Bank of England raised its key interest rate for the 12th consecutive time and signaled more increases are possible.

item.title: The DTCC is selling data that sophisticated traders can use to profit at the expense of more traditional investors, according to a report by Themis Trading.
item.description: The DTCC is selling data that sophisticated traders can use to profit at the expense of more traditional investors, according to a report by Themis Trading.

item.title: Christie's kicked off New York's spring auction series with a $178 million sale of art from the estate of S.I. Newhouse Jr.
item.description: Christie’s kicked off New York’s spring auction series with a $178 million sale of art from the estate of S.I. Newhouse Jr.

item.title: The U.S. economy showed fresh signs of cooling, with a reading of supplier inflation moderating and applications for unemployment benefits rising.
item.description: The U.S. economy showed fresh signs of cooling, with a reading of supplier inflation moderating and applications for unemployment benefits rising.
